intro: Homalium gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-leafed evergreen. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae, characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and showy, clustered flowers. Native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often followed by bright red berries. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in warm climates.
